sentences.en: a news story manufactured by an unscrupulous journalist
sentences.cn: 一位不道德的记者编造的一篇报道

sentences.en: He has done me such an unscrupulous shot in the eye.
sentences.cn: 他如此肆无忌惮地恶意中伤我.
他是个不择手段的商人.

sentences.en: He is unscrupulous in his exploitation of people.
sentences.cn: 他寡廉鲜耻地剥削人民.
他这个人招人喜欢,又厚颜无耻.

sentences.en: He was cruel, treacherous and unscrupulous.
sentences.cn: 他残忍 、 奸诈、不择手段.

sentences.en: Her fortune is already more than sufficient to attract those unscrupulous adventurers.
sentences.cn: 她的财产已经多得足以引起那些贪得无厌的冒险者的觊觎.

sentences.en: In his " History of New York ", Irving pictured it as a region of unscrupulous Yankee traders.
sentences.cn: 欧文在《纽约外史 》 里把它描写成利欲熏心的杨基商人群集之地.

sentences.en: Instead, higher borrowing costs are seen as the result of unscrupulous speculation.
sentences.cn: 更高的借贷成本被认为是不法投机的结果而非原因.

sentences.en: She was a designing , an audacious and an unscrupulous young person.
sentences.cn: 她是个工于心计、轻佻放肆,不讲道德的年轻女子.

sentences.en: The unscrupulous swindlers bled his victims white.
sentences.cn: 无耻的骗子榨干了受骗者的血汗.

sentences.en: These kids are being exploited by very unscrupulous people.
sentences.cn: 这些孩子正在被无良之人利用。

sentences.en: This ignorance provides ideal terrain for every sort of unscrupulous commercial venture.
sentences.cn: 这种无知是无耻的商业冒险者的温床.

sentences.en: Unscrupulous use of one's position to derive profit or advantages; extortion.
sentences.cn: 无耻地利用职位来取得利益或好处; 勒索,敲诈.

sentences.en: You always take part with the unscrupulous man.
sentences.cn: 你总是袒护那些肆无忌惮的人.

words.tran_cn: 无道德原则地；不客气地

trans.tran_cn: 肆无忌惮的，不择手段的，无道德原则的，没有节操的，恣意
trans.tran_en: behaving in an unfair or dishonest way
